subject: Re: [junit] Re: Mock objects...
msgSnippet: ... You could have used dynamic mocks (a la http://mockobjects.sourceforge.net/javadoc/1.4/com/mockobjects/dynamic/Mock.html or
messageBody:
On Friday 16 July 2004 08:37 pm, cypherfox wrote:
>
> Sure, the most recent example of this to me, was this class:
>   http://www.vixen.com/code/JournalHash.java
> implementing
>   http://www.vixen.com/code/JournalDataStore.java

You could have used dynamic mocks (a la
http://mockobjects.sourceforge.net/javadoc/1.4/com/mockobjects/dynamic/Mock.html
or http://mockobjects.com/DynaMock.html) wherein you tell your mock what
calls, results, and constraints are expected. Then you just send the message
verify() to the mock at the end of the test.
